title: Rearrange expression and group like terms
text: Use the associative and commutative property of multiplication to group like terms together
speech: Use the associative and commutative property of multiplication to group like terms together
pacedSpeech: Use the associative and commutative property of multiplication to group like terms together

title: Rearrange expression and group like terms
text: In this expression, what is the like term of $$a^4$$?
speech: In this expression, what is the like term of  a to the fourth ?
pacedSpeech: In this expression, what is the like term of   a to the fourth

title: Rearrange expression and group like terms
text: $$18$$ and $$-27$$ are consider as like terms because they are both real numbers. $$a^4$$ and $$a^9$$ are consider like terms because they are different power of a. Similar for $$b^8$$ and $$b^5$$
speech: 18  and  negative 27  are consider as like terms because they are both real numbers.  a to the fourth  and  a to the ninth  are consider like terms because they are different power of a. Similar for  b to the eighth  and  b to the fifth
pacedSpeech: are consider as like terms because they are both real numbers.   a to the fourth
are consider like terms because they are different power of a. Similar for   b to the eighth

title: Simplify each group
text: We can rewrite the given expression in a new way by grouping the like terms using parenthese, $$\frac{18a^4 b^8}{\left(-27a^9 b^5\right)}=\frac{18}{-27} \frac{a^4}{a^9} \frac{b^8}{b^5}$$
speech: We can rewrite the given expression in a new way by grouping the like terms using parenthese,  fraction, 18 a to the fourth b to the eighth, over, parentheses, negative 27 a to the ninth b to the fifth ,  is equal to fraction, 18 over, negative 27,  fraction, a to the fourth, over, a to the ninth,  fraction, b to the eighth, over, b to the fifth,
pacedSpeech: We can rewrite the given expression in a new way by grouping the like terms using parenthese,  this expression

title: Simplify each group
speech: Simplify  fraction, a to the fourth, over, a to the ninth,

title: Simplify each group

subHints.title: Rules for simplify power
subHints.text: Given a real number $$x$$, and m,n integers, $$\frac{a^m}{a^n}=a^{m-n}$$ and $$a^m a^n=a^{m+n}$$

speech: Simplify  fraction, b to the eighth, over, b to the fifth,
pacedSpeech: Simplify   fraction, b to the eighth, over, b to the fifth,

title: Multiply each group together
text: Then, replace the each group with its simplified form we get $$\left(-\frac{2}{3}\right) \frac{1}{a^5} b^3$$
speech: Then, replace the each group with its simplified form we get  negative 2 thirds times, fraction, 1 over, a to the fifth,  b cubed
pacedSpeech: Then, replace the each group with its simplified form we get   negative 2 thirds times, fraction, 1 over, a to the fifth,  b cubed

title: Fraction mutiplication Rule
text: The final step is take $$\left(-\frac{2}{3}\right) \frac{1}{a^5} b^3$$ and turn it into fraction form using fraction multiplication.

subHints.title: Fraction mutiplication Rule
subHints.text: As a reminder, given fractions $$\frac{a}{b}$$ and $$\frac{d}{c}$$ where a, $$d$$ are real number, and $$b$$, c are non zero real number, $$\frac{a}{b} \frac{d}{c}=\frac{a d}{b c}$$. we can write $$b^3$$ as $$\frac{b^3}{1}$$

speech: The final step is take  negative 2 thirds times, fraction, 1 over, a to the fifth,  b cubed  and turn it into fraction form using fraction multiplication.
pacedSpeech: The final step is take   negative 2 thirds times, fraction, 1 over, a to the fifth,  b cubed
and turn it into fraction form using fraction multiplication.
